key_risks: Profitability challenges due to high customer acquisition costs and claims payouts
Regulatory scrutiny and potential legal risks
Competitive pressures in the pet insurance market
Economic sensitivity tied to discretionary spending on pets
controversies: Customer complaints about frequent premium increases and claim denials
BBB complaints regarding system glitches and lack of agent availability
Regulatory fines for violations by subsidiary, American Pet Insurance Co.
social_issues: Customer dissatisfaction with premium hikes and claim handling processes
Reputational risks from ethical concerns over premium increases and claim denials
governance_issues: Potential disruptions from stricter pet insurance laws

sources.snippet: One of the primary reasons for Trupanion's ongoing losses is the high cost of acquiring new customers. (Nasdaq:TRUP), a leading provider of medical insurance for cats and dogs, today provided an update on regulatory allegations made by The Capitol Forum. sources.title: Trupanion fined $100,000 in Washington over sales tactics
sources.snippet: Trupanion, founded in 2000 in Vancouver, B.C., sells pet insurance in Canada and the United States. Its headquarters are in Seattle.
